intro: Gulubia liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu gulubia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
